course_description: Course objectives are to help students: become familiar with important topics in consumer behavior research; become familiar with the common methodology of consumer behavior research; learn how to evaluate cvonsumer behavior research; develop a consumer bejavior research idea that would contribute to the corpus of knowledge and design an experiment to test the theory; and practice academic presentation and writing skills.
prerequisites: This section is reserved for students in the PhD program.
sections: Class Nbr: 4901, Section #: 5101, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: Does Not Meet, Instructor: Hamilton/Ward, Status: Open
